article:
'J.J. Belle' (born Roger Elvidge Belle, French Guyana, 17 October 1955, died 26
November 2004 [http://thedeadrockstarsclub.com/2004b.html The Dead Rock
Stars Club - 2004 July to December], accessed 2012-07-15 ) was a renowned
British session musician, mostly known for his work as a guitarist. Artists he
played for included Marc Almond, Fish (playing guitar on the US leg of his 1997
Sunsets on Empire tour), Debbie Harry, Johnny Hates Jazz, Grace Jones, George
Michael, Madonna, Dusty Springfield and Tina Turner. Belle also frequently
worked for the Pet Shop Boys, who declared he helped define their sound in a
statement on his death of cancer in
2004. [http://www.petshopboys.co.uk/news/143/200412 Pet Shop Boys â News â
JJ Belle R.I.P.], accessed 2012-07-15
